revised_title: Incombustible Cloth: Experiments and Observations by the Royal Society
tldr: A letter from Nicholas Waite describes an experiment conducted by the Royal Society on an incombustible cloth from China. The cloth was exposed to fire and did not burn, even when oil was poured on it while red-hot. The cloth's fire-resistant properties were confirmed in multiple experiments, leading to further investigation and discussion within the scientific community.
